skill.name: web-browser
skill.description: Allows to interact with web pages by performing actions such as clicking buttons, filling out forms, and navigating links. It works by remote controlling Google Chrome or Chromium browsers using the Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP). When Claude needs to browse the web, it can use this skill to do so.
skill.summary: Allows to interact with web pages by performing actions such as clicking buttons, filling out forms,...
skill.author: Dwsy

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate browser automation skill using Chrome DevTools Protocol. The static analyzer flagged patterns common to both automation tools and malicious software. After evaluating the code context, all high-severity findings are false positives. The skill's external command usage (spawn, execSync, backticks) is for legitimate browser management: starting Chrome, killing processes, creating directories, and syncing user profiles. The 'C2 keywords' flagged in dependencies are standard npm packages (commander, proxy-agent, degenerator) required by puppeteer-core. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' findings are checksum verification in archive libraries. The skill does have elevated privileges by design (browser control), but this is its intended function with no evidence of credential exfiltration or data theft.

content.user_title: Control Chrome browser for web automation
content.value_statement: Automate web browser interactions for scraping, testing, and data extraction. Control Chrome remotely via Chrome DevTools Protocol to click, navigate, evaluate JavaScript, and capture screenshots programmatically.
actual_capabilities: Start Chrome browser with remote debugging on localhost port 9222
Navigate to URLs and manage browser tabs programmatically
Execute JavaScript in browser context for extraction and interaction
Interactively pick and select DOM elements by clicking
limitations: Requires Google Chrome or Chromium installed on the system
Works only on macOS with hardcoded Chrome paths (can be adapted for other platforms)
Cannot bypass authentication or access protected content without user credentials
JavaScript execution is limited to browser context, not system shell

use_cases.title: Test web applications
use_cases.description: Automate UI testing by programmatically clicking elements, filling forms, and verifying page state.

use_cases.title: Extract web data
use_cases.description: Scrape websites by navigating pages and executing JavaScript to extract structured data.

use_cases.title: Verify page behavior
use_cases.description: Take screenshots and evaluate page content to verify visual and functional correctness.

prompt_templates.title: Navigate and explore
prompt_templates.prompt: Start Chrome and navigate to https://example.com. What is the page title?

prompt_templates.title: Extract structured data
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to https://news.ycombinator.com and extract all article titles using eval.js.

prompt_templates.title: Visual verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Take a screenshot of the current page and save it to a temp file.

prompt_templates.title: Interactive selection
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the element picker to find the submit button on the page.

output_examples.input: Navigate to example.com and extract all links
Find all headings on the page

best_practices: Use the --profile flag only when you need to persist login sessions across runs
Always verify JavaScript code before evaluating it in the browser context
Close Chrome properly after automation tasks to avoid resource leaks
anti_patterns: Avoid executing untrusted JavaScript code that could modify page behavior
Do not use this skill to automate login flows with stolen credentials
Avoid leaving Chrome running in the background after tasks complete

faq.question: Does this skill work on Linux or Windows?
faq.answer: Currently designed for macOS with hardcoded Chrome paths. Can be modified for other platforms.

faq.question: Can I automate form submissions?
faq.answer: Yes, use eval.js to execute JavaScript that fills form fields and triggers submit events.

faq.question: Is my browsing data secure?
faq.answer: The skill runs locally on localhost:9222. Profile sync requires explicit --profile flag.

faq.question: Can I use this for web scraping?
faq.answer: Yes, but respect website terms of service and robots.txt when scraping.

faq.question: What JavaScript can I execute?
faq.answer: Any JavaScript that runs in browser context. Access DOM, modify content, extract data.

faq.question: How do I stop Chrome when done?
faq.answer: The skill manages Chrome lifecycle. Use Ctrl+C or run 'killall Google Chrome' to stop.
